column2: A ruler's spouse can be a powerful asset in the management of the realm. However, the extent to which a spouse holds powers must be carefully and precisely defined.
The spouse plays a very minor role in the realm, contributing only with a few words of advice here and there.
The ruler delegates some minor tasks to the spouse thereby increasing the efficiency with which the realm can be managed.
The powers of the spouse increase, allowing the spouse to lend a hand in a much more effective manner.
The spouse takes part in, and manages, delegated aspects of rulership with more autonomy. Allowing the ruler to focus on other tasks not only longer, but also with increased vigor.
The realm can hardly function without the support and advice from a competent spouse who takes a lot of the stress of managing the realm off from the shoulders of the ruler.
